content.data:
Import Cutlist allows you to bring in a list of Parts in a CSV format 
 for Optimization. You can use your favorite spreadsheet application or 
 design application to create a CSV that can be imported directly into 
 the S2M Optimizer.

This utility examines the text file that you are importing and helps 
 you ensure that the data is imported in the way that you want. You can 
 use this Utility to define what each field in your Text file represents 
 so it is imported properly.

There 
 are four options in the toolbar:

Allows you to select which of your Saved 
 data field configurations to use.

Allows you to Save the current configuration 
 for re-use.

Allows you to rename the currently selected 
 configuration.

Allows you to delete the currently selected 
 configuration.
There are four general options available to configure your Text file:

Fields -  This option allows 
 you to establish how the fields in the Text file are defined.  If 
 items in the text file are separated by tabs, colons, semicolons, spaces, 
 or other characters, select Delimited; then select what the delimiter 
 is (Tab, Comma, Semicolon, Space, Other).  If all of the items in 
 each column are the same length, select Fixed width.

Text Qualifier -  Select the 
 character that encloses values in your text file. When Solid encounters 
 the text qualifier character, all of the text that follows that character 
 and precedes the next occurrence of that character is imported as one 
 value, even if the text contains a delimiter character. For example, if 
 the delimiter is a comma (,) and the text qualifier is a quotation mark 
 ("), "Tuscaloosa, Alabama" is imported into one field as 
 Tuscaloosa, Alabama.

Dimensions -  Select whether 
 the file you are importing is Inches or Metric.

Start Import at Line -  Type 
 or select a line number to specify the first line of the data that you 
 want to import.

In this are you will see all of the columns that the S2M Optimizer has 
 available for your Text file. Click the column header of the column(s) 
 that you do not want Ignored and set its type. There are eleven options:

Ignore -  Will ignore this column 
 when importing.

Material -  The Material the 
 Part will be cut from.

Grain -  Establishes if the Part 
 is Grained or not.

Assembly -  The Name/Description 
 of the Assembly the Part is used in.

Assembly Number -  The Assembly 
 Number of the Assembly the Part is used in.

Banding -  The banding instructions 
 for the Part. The banding instructions should only include Banding Codes 
 you have defined within the S2M Center Material Catalog (lower case letters). 
 N or 0 (zero) would equal an Edge with no Banding. The banding instructions 
 will only define four edges. In the example below would be the "Banding" 
 for the illustrated Part.

4 Edges starting from the reference point and going clockwise you get 
 None, b , None, None.
